content: Given the following mathematical function expressions, you need to calculate the indefinite integral of the function (excluding the constant C), then substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral, and finally provide me with the integer result of the expression by rounding down. (The answer should consist of only a single integer number representing the final result, with no additional words.)

" First, let's calculate the indefinite integral of the function.

The indefinite integral of x/(1+x) can be derived using the formula:

∫ x/(1+x) dx = xln(1+x) / (1+x) + C

Now, substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral:

xln(1+x) / (1+x) + C = 4ln(1+4) / (1+4) + C

Now, let's calculate the value of the expression:

4ln(1+4) / (1+4) + C = 4ln(5) / 5 + C

As you can see, the result contains a constant of integration 'C'. Since you asked me to provide only the integer result, I will round down the value of the expression to the nearest integer:

4ln(5) / 5 + C ≈ 1.296 + C

Since the final result should consist of only a single integer number, I will round down the value to 1:

1"

" \"The indefinite integral of x/(1+x) can be derived using the formula:\\n\\n∫ x/(1+x) dx = xln(1+x) / (1+x) + C\\n\\nNow, substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral:\\n\\nxln(1+x) / (1+x) + C = 4ln(1+4) / (1+4) + C\\n\\nNow, let's calculate the value of the expression:\\n\\n4ln(1+4) / (1+4) + C = 4ln(5) / 5 + C\\n\\nAs you can see, the result contains a constant of integration 'C'. Since you asked me to provide only the integer result, I will round down the value of the expression to the nearest integer:\\n\\n4ln(5) / 5 + C ≈ 1.296 + C\\n\\nSince the final result should consist of only a single integer number, I will round down the value to 1:\\n\\n1\""
